title: One dead, 10 injured in Sri Lanka’s protest – hospital
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – One dead and 10 people injured in Sri Lanka’s central town of Rampukkana, a hospital source said, after police fired gunshots to control a violent situation.
“One dead and 10 injured,” a source at Kegalle Teaching Hospital told Economy Next.
It was the first death in the protests against the government that has prevailed from March 31.

Protests erupted across the country after the government raised the fuel prices sharply to record high. The fuel price hike resulted in the price increase of wheat flour, bread, and transport, which angered the public. Some also protested against shortage of fuel.
Police Spokesman Nihal Thalduwa said the police fired after protesters started pelting stones at them.’

“Police warned the protesters but they never listened. They damage the public properties. Then the police used tear gas to disperse them. Later the protesters started to attack the police with rocks,” he told media.

“To control the situation, the police fired and some people have been injured. They are now treated at hospital. Some police officials who got injured also are treated at the hospital” (Colombo/April 19/2022)
